description: Secure FTP Server Hosting with Web Interface, FTP, SFTP, WebDAV, LDAP amp; File Sharing.

events.name: webhookEvent
steps: Visit the Behaviors tab of a folder you would like to assign a Webhook to

blocks.name: getAllUsers
blocks.description: This endpoint lists all users on the current site.

blocks.name: getSingleUser
blocks.description: This endpoint shows a single user.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each User. Each user is given an ID automatically upon creation.

blocks.name: createUser
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a new user on the current site.

args.name: username
args.info: Username for the user. This is how the user will be displayed on the site.

args.name: password
args.info: Password for the user. This property is write-only. It cannot be retrieved via the API.

args.name: name
args.info: Real name of the user. For your reference.

args.name: notes
args.info: You may use this property to store any additional information you require. There are no restrictions on its formatting.

args.name: groupIds
args.info: IDs of the Groups that this user is in.

args.name: ftpPermission
args.info: Allow user access via FTP/FTPS (port 21 or 990) interface.

args.name: sftpPermission
args.info: Allow user access via SFTP (port 22) interface.

args.name: davPermission
args.info: Allow user access via WebDAV (port 443) interface.

args.name: restapiPermission
args.info: Allow user access the REST API, via HTTP/HTTPS (port 80 or 443), and the desktop application.

args.name: attachmentsPermission
args.info: Allow user to use Sharing tab in web interface to share files with anonymous users via a unique URL.

args.name: selfManaged
args.info: Allow user to change their password and user information via the web interface.

args.name: requirePasswordChange
args.info: Require user to change their password at their next login. Note: requires restapi_permission to be true, as password changes can only occur via the web interface.

args.name: allowedIps
args.info: List allowed IPs, one per line. You may specify a range in CIDR format, such as 192.168.1.0/27. Leave blank to allow all IPs. If you are also restricting IP addresses on the Site tab, users matching in either place will be allowed to log in.

args.name: userRoot
args.info: Folder to show as the root when this user logs in via the FTP interface. Make sure this folder exists, as it will not be automatically created. Does not apply to the web interface! This should not contain a leading slash, but must contain a trailing slash. Example: Users/jenny/.

args.name: grantPermission
args.info: Value must be set to full, read, write, preview, read+write, or preview+write. The user will be granted that permission on their FTP root folder as defined by the user_root. This property is write-only. It cannot be retrieved via the User resource of the REST API, though may be obtained with the Permissions resource of the REST API.

blocks.name: updateUser
blocks.description: This method updates an existing user.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each User. Each user is given an ID automatically upon creation.

args.name: username
args.info: Username for the user. This is how the user will be displayed on the site.

args.name: password
args.info: Password for the user. This property is write-only. It cannot be retrieved via the API.

args.name: name
args.info: Real name of the user. For your reference.

args.name: notes
args.info: You may use this property to store any additional information you require. There are no restrictions on its formatting.

args.name: groupIds
args.info: IDs of the Groups that this user is in.

args.name: ftpPermission
args.info: Allow user access via FTP/FTPS (port 21 or 990) interface.

args.name: sftpPermission
args.info: Allow user access via SFTP (port 22) interface.

args.name: davPermission
args.info: Allow user access via WebDAV (port 443) interface.

args.name: restapiPermission
args.info: Allow user access the REST API, via HTTP/HTTPS (port 80 or 443), and the desktop application.

args.name: attachmentsPermission
args.info: Allow user to use Sharing tab in web interface to share files with anonymous users via a unique URL.

args.name: selfManaged
args.info: Allow user to change their password and user information via the web interface.

args.name: requirePasswordChange
args.info: Require user to change their password at their next login. Note: requires restapi_permission to be true, as password changes can only occur via the web interface.

args.name: allowedIps
args.info: List allowed IPs, one per line. You may specify a range in CIDR format, such as 192.168.1.0/27. Leave blank to allow all IPs. If you are also restricting IP addresses on the Site tab, users matching in either place will be allowed to log in.

args.name: userRoot
args.info: Folder to show as the root when this user logs in via the FTP interface. Make sure this folder exists, as it will not be automatically created. Does not apply to the web interface! This should not contain a leading slash, but must contain a trailing slash. Example: Users/jenny/.

args.name: grantPermission
args.info: Value must be set to full, read, write, preview, read+write, or preview+write. The user will be granted that permission on their FTP root folder as defined by the user_root. This property is write-only. It cannot be retrieved via the User resource of the REST API, though may be obtained with the Permissions resource of the REST API.

blocks.name: deleteUser
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a user.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each User. Each user is given an ID automatically upon creation.

blocks.name: unlockUser
blocks.description: This endpoint unlocks a user that has been locked out by Brute Force Login Protection.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each User. Each user is given an ID automatically upon creation.

blocks.name: getAllGroups
blocks.description: This endpoint lists all groups on the current site.

blocks.name: getSingleGroup
blocks.description: This endpoint shows a single group.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Group. Each group is given an ID automatically upon creation.

blocks.name: createGroup
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a new group on the current site.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the Group. This is how the group will be displayed on the site.

args.name: notes
args.info: You may use this property to store any additional information you require. There are no restrictions on its formatting.

args.name: userIds
args.info: IDs of the Users that are in this group.

blocks.name: updateGroup
blocks.description: This method updates an existing group.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Group. Each group is given an ID automatically upon creation.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the Group. This is how the group will be displayed on the site.

args.name: notes
args.info: You may use this property to store any additional information you require. There are no restrictions on its formatting.

args.name: userIds
args.info: IDs of the Users that are in this group.

blocks.name: deleteGroup
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a group.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Group. Each group is given an ID automatically upon creation.

blocks.name: getAllPermissions
blocks.description: This endpoint shows all Permissions on the current Site.

blocks.name: createPermission
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a new Permission record.

args.name: path
args.info: Folder path for the permission to apply to. This must be slash-delimited, but it must neither start nor end with a slash.

args.name: permission
args.info: Value must be set to full, readonly, writeonly, or previewonly, depending on the type of access to be granted by the Permission.

args.name: userId
args.info: Unique identifier for the user being granted a permission. Each user is given an ID automatically upon creation. The user_id and group_id fields cannot both be set.

args.name: groupId
args.info: Unique identifier for the group being granted a permission. Each group is given an ID automatically upon creation. The user_id and group_id fields cannot both be set.

args.name: recursive
args.info: If set to false, the permission will be non-recursive, and will not apply to subfolders of the folder specified by the path property.

blocks.name: deletePermission
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a permission record.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Permission. Each permission is given an ID automatically upon creation.

blocks.name: getAllNotifications
blocks.description: This endpoint shows all Notifications on the current Site.

blocks.name: createNotification
blocks.description: The create endpoint creates a notification record.

args.name: path
args.info: Folder path for notifications. This must be slash-delimited, but it must neither start nor end with a slash.

args.name: userId
args.info: Unique identifier for the user being notified. Each user is given an ID automatically upon creation. You can look up user IDs by using the User resource of this REST API.

args.name: username
args.info: Username for the user given by user_id. If this value is set during creation and user_id is not set, the user_id is looked up from the username and set.

blocks.name: deleteNotification
blocks.description: The delete endpoint deletes a notification record.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Notification. Each notification is given an ID automatically upon creation.

blocks.name: getAllHistory
blocks.description: This endpoint shows the entire history for the current site. The history starts with the most recent entries and proceeds back in time. There is a maximum number of records that will be returned with a single request (default 1000 or whatever value you provide as the per_page parameter, up to a maximum of 10,000).

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of items to return in this request.

args.name: perPage
args.info: Requested number of items returned per request. Default: 1000, maximum: 10000. Leave blank for default (strongly recommended).

args.name: startAt
args.info: Date and time in the history to start from.

blocks.name: getLoginHistory
blocks.description: This endpoint shows login history only. The history starts with the most recent entries and proceeds back in time. There is a maximum number of records that will be returned with a single request (default 1000 or whatever value you provide as the per_page parameter, up to a maximum of 10,000).

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of items to return in this request.

args.name: perPage
args.info: Requested number of items returned per request. Default: 1000, maximum: 10000. Leave blank for default (strongly recommended).

args.name: startAt
args.info: Date and time in the history to start from.

blocks.name: getUserHistory
blocks.description: This endpoint shows all history for a specific user. The history starts with the most recent entries and proceeds back in time. There is a maximum number of records that will be returned with a single request (default 1000 or whatever value you provide as the per_page parameter, up to a maximum of 10,000).

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each History entry.

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of items to return in this request.

args.name: perPage
args.info: Requested number of items returned per request. Default: 1000, maximum: 10000. Leave blank for default (strongly recommended).

args.name: startAt
args.info: Date and time in the history to start from.

blocks.name: getFolderHistory
blocks.description: This endpoint shows all history for a specific folder. The history starts with the most recent entries and proceeds back in time.

args.name: path
args.info: Path of the file or folder associated with the History entry.

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of items to return in this request.

args.name: perPage
args.info: Requested number of items returned per request. Default: 1000, maximum: 10000. Leave blank for default (strongly recommended).

args.name: startAt
args.info: Date and time in the history to start from.

blocks.name: getFileHistory
blocks.description: This endpoint shows all history for a specific file. The history starts with the most recent entries and proceeds back in time.

args.name: path
args.info: Path of the file or folder associated with the History entry.

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of items to return in this request.

args.name: perPage
args.info: Requested number of items returned per request. Default: 1000, maximum: 10000. Leave blank for default (strongly recommended).

args.name: startAt
args.info: Date and time in the history to start from.

blocks.name: getAllBundles
blocks.description: This endpoint lists all Bundles on the current Site.

blocks.name: getSingleBundle
blocks.description: This endpoint shows a single bundle.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Group. Each group is given an ID automatically upon creation.

blocks.name: createBundle
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a bundle.

args.name: paths
args.info: List of the paths associated with the Bundle.

blocks.name: deleteBundle
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a group.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Bundle.

blocks.name: listsBundleContent
blocks.description: This endpoint lists the contents of a bundle. When no path is specified, the contents of the root of the bundle will be listed.

args.name: code
args.info: Unique code string identifier for the Bundle.

blocks.name: downloadBundleContent
blocks.description: This endpoint provides download URLs that will enable you to download the files in a bundle. The download URLs are direct URLs to Amazon S3 that have been signed by BrickFTP to provide temporary access to the files. The download links are valid for 3 minutes.

args.name: code
args.info: Unique code string identifier for the Bundle.

args.name: paths
args.info: List of the paths associated with the Bundle.

blocks.name: getAllBehaviors
blocks.description: This endpoint lists all Behaviors on the current Site.

blocks.name: getFolderBehavior
blocks.description: This endpoint shows the behaviors that apply to the given path.

args.name: path
args.info: Folder path for behaviors. This must be slash-delimited, but it must neither start nor end with a slash.

args.name: recursive
args.info: If set to false, the permission will be non-recursive, and will not apply to subfolders of the folder specified by the path property.

blocks.name: getSingleBehavior
blocks.description: This endpoint shows a single behavior.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Behavior.

blocks.name: createBehavior
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a behavior.

args.name: path
args.info: Folder path for behaviors. This must be slash-delimited, but it must neither start nor end with a slash.

args.name: behavior
args.info: The behavior type. Will be one of the following: webhook.

args.name: value
args.info: List of values associated with the behavior.

blocks.name: updateBehavior
blocks.description: This endpoint updates an existing behavior.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Behavior.

args.name: behavior
args.info: The behavior type. Will be one of the following: webhook.

args.name: value
args.info: List of values associated with the behavior.

blocks.name: deleteBehavior
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a behavior.

args.name: id
args.info: Globally unique identifier of each Behavior.

blocks.name: listsFolderContent
blocks.description: The index endpoint lists the contents of the folder provided in the URL. Remember that a blank URL refers to the root folder.

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of items to return in this request.

args.name: perPage
args.info: Requested number of items returned per request. Maximum: 5000, leave blank for default (strongly recommended).

args.name: search
args.info: Only return items matching the given search text.

args.name: sortByPath
args.info: Sort by file name, and value is either asc or desc to indicate normal or reverse sort.

args.name: sortBySize
args.info: Sort by file size, and value is either asc or desc to indicate smaller files first or larger files first, respectively.

args.name: sortByModified
args.info: Sort by modification time, and value is either asc or desc to indicate older files first or newer files first, respectively.

blocks.name: createFolder
blocks.description: The create endpoint creates a folder.

blocks.name: downloadFile
blocks.description: This endpoint provides a download URL that will enable you to download a file. The download URL is a direct URL to Amazon S3 that has been signed by BrickFTP to provide temporary access to the file. The download links are valid for 3 minutes.

blocks.name: moveFile
blocks.description: This endpoint moves a file or folder

blocks.name: renameFile
blocks.description: This endpoint renames a file or folder

blocks.name: copyFile
blocks.description: This endpoint copies a file or folder to the destination folder.

blocks.name: deleteFile
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a file or folder.

blocks.name: startFileUpload
blocks.description: The first request to upload a new file.

blocks.name: uploadFilePart
blocks.description: At this point, you are to send a request to the endpoint provided by BrickFTP with the file data and the headers and parameters provided to you from BrickFTP.

args.name: uploadUri
args.info: The URL where the file is uploaded to.

blocks.name: additionalUpload
blocks.description: Once an upload has been opened and before it is completed, additional upload URLs can be requested from the REST API.

args.name: ref
args.info: Returned at the start of the upload

args.name: part
args.info: Set to the part number the upload URL should refer to.

blocks.name: completeUpload
blocks.description: After uploading the file to the file storage environment, the REST API needs to be notified that the upload was completed.

args.name: ref
args.info: Returned at the start of the upload
